resources.string: sRGB red in Display P3 tagged image
This application uses standard Android APIs to test wide gamut support on your device.
API support for wide gamut is added in Android 8.1. However, there are still some device vendors having trouble handling it properly nowadays.

Unfortunately, even if the application requests a wide color gamut display, the application has no way of knowing if the device is displaying the expected colors correctly. You may need to compare the device screen to a reference or measure it using a spectrometer/colorimeter.
Recent iOS devices (open browser test in Safari)
This application will request a wide gamut view and present sRGB red and Display P3 red on it. You need to check if the device shows two colors correctly.
1. No (awareness of) wide gamut: Display P3 red looks identical to sRGB red.
2. Color profile mismatch: Software has done all necessary color conversion, but the display is set to an incorrect mode.
3. No color management: Both Display P3 red and untagged red are shown as display native or calibrated red.
